CatDescriptText: Mrs. Thelma Jeffries, hospital dietician, 7103 Mount Vernon Street was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 28, 1959, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that education standards should be the same throughout the city school system or should they be lowered in order to accommodate the slower-learning pupils, particularly those who suffer the handicaps of poor home or neighborhood environments?" answer reads: "I don't think that the standards should be lowered. Rather, I think that there should be a special training class, in which the emphasis would be on seeing just what the trouble is with the slow learning child.  The teacher would be similar to a psychiatrist in determining just what is wrong with the slow learning student."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Thelma Jeffries wearing light colored tweed coat, eyeglasses, and dark knitted hood, standing on sidewalk in front of stores
